After web search: Sure, here's a recipe for a Cheesy Carrot Casserole:

- Start by preparing the carrots. Steam or boil them until soft.
- In a saucepan, melt 1/2 cup of butter and add 1/2 cup of medium onion. Cook until the onions are soft and translucent.
- Add 1/4 cup of flour to the mixture, stirring well to combine. Cook for another minute.
- Gradually stir in milk or a dairy substitute (use enough to reach your desired consistency) while continuing to cook and thicken the sauce.
- Season with salt, mustard, and pepper as per taste preferences.
- Add the cooked carrots to the saucepan and mix well until they are evenly coated.
- Transfer the mixture to a baking dish. Top it off with buttery crackers for added texture (as in the recipe from Julie's Eats & Treats).
- Bake at 375°F (190°C) until bubbly and golden on top, about 25-30 minutes.

This Cheesy Carrot Casserole is a comforting vegetable side dish that pairs well with any main course. Enjoy your meal!
